info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 20 at 1:50PM MDT until April 21 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning remains in effect from noon to 8 PM today for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 221, 222, and 224 through 230, which includes the San Luis valley, the Sangre De Cristo and Wet Mountains, Fremont, Teller, El Paso, Pueblo, Huerfano, western Las Animas counties... ...Red Flag Warning has been issued for Thursday 12PM to 9PM for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 222, 224, 225, 229, 230, and 233 which includes the San Luis Valley, the Wet Mountain Valley, and Fremont, Huerfano, and Las Animas Counties... ...Fire Weather Watch has been issued for Friday morning through evening for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which includes the San Luis Valley, the Wet Mountain Valley, Fremont and Teller Counties and the rest of the eastern plains... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 222... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 222... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 222... The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Thursday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity is in effect from Friday morning through Friday evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 222. * Winds...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * Timing...Noon until 8 PM today. * Relative Humidity...As low as 9 percent. * Temperatures...In the upper 50s. * Lightning... * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
